SEARCH

Class javaproject

java.lang.Object
javaproject
public class javaproject extends Object
This class javaproject provides command-line interference for the user for operations like: Statistical Information about an array, matrix operations, text encryption/decryption, and a Tic-tac-toe game

    • resetGame

      public static void resetGame()
      Resets the game variables for a new round

    • getPlayerPosition

      public static int getPlayerPosition(String player, char[][] gameBoard)
      Prompts the specified player to enter their placement on the game board. Validates the input to ensure it's an integer between 1 and 9, and checks if the position is already taken.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is making the move ("Player 1" or "Player 2")
      gameBoard - The current state of the game board
      scan - The scanner object to read user input
      Returns:
      The position chosen by the player (1-9)
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException - if the input is not an integer.

    • printGameBoard

      public static void printGameBoard(char[][] gameBoard)
      Prints the current state of the game board
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - The current state of the game board

    • placePiece

      public static void placePiece(char[][] gameBoard, int pos, String user)
      Places the player's symbol ('X' or 'O') on the game board
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - The current state of the game board
      pos - The position chosen by the player (1-9)
      user - The player making the move ("player 1" or "player 2")

    • containsAll

      public static boolean containsAll(int[] positions, int count, int[] winningCombination)
      Checks whether a player has a winning combination of positions
      Parameters:
      positions - The array of positions selected by a player
      count - The number of moves made by the player so far
      winningCombination - The winning combination of positions to check
      Returns:
      true if the player has all positions in the winning combination, false otherwise

    • checkEnd

      public static String checkEnd()
      Checks whether the game has ended in a win or tie, based on the current game state
      Returns:
      A string describing the result of the game (either "Player 1 won!", "Player 2 won!", or "TIE!"), or an empty string if the game has not yet ended
